title: Crossing glaciers and fjords: Norwegian reindeer migrate for winter
description: A herd of reindeer with white, brown or gray coats climb mountains and swim between glaciers on their great migration to their winter pasture in Norway's far north.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Mysterious antimatter observed falling down for first time
description: For the first time, scientists have observed antimatter particles—the mysterious twins of the visible matter all around us—falling downwards due to the effect of gravity, Europe's physics lab CERN announced on Wednesday.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Separating molecules requires a lot of energy. This nanoporous, heat-resistant membrane could change that
description: Industry has long relied upon energy-intensive processes, such as distillation and crystallization, to separate molecules that ultimately serve as ingredients in medicine, chemicals and other products.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: World's biggest bat colony gathers in Zambia every year. Researchers used artificial intelligence to count them
description: Everybody who visits Kasanka National Park in Zambia during "bat season" agrees that the evening emergence of African straw-colored fruit bats from their roost site is one of the wildlife wonders of the world. The bats (Eidolon helvum) arrive at Kasanka every year around October. The numbers swell rapidly until they peak in November. By January they are gone again.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Earthworms contribute to 6.5% of world grain production: study
description: Most gardeners know that earthworms help keep soils healthy, now scientists have assessed just how important their underground activities are to global food production—and how to protect them.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Saturday Citations: Volcano vs. asteroid; NASA's supernova time lapse; immortal chemicals
description: This week, we're highlighting a study involving toxic chemical contaminants, and just for fun, a second study involving other toxic chemical contaminants. But NASA made a cool time-lapse video using the good old Hubble space telescope, and a group of Italian demographers have a lot to say about the population-level consequences of lying.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: As rain vanishes, Guatemalans learn to use every drop of water
description: As rain becomes ever scarcer in northern Guatemala, communities are learning how to carve out makeshift irrigation canals and purify their water to conserve every last precious drop.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Things to know about the Nobel Prizes
description: Fall has arrived in Scandinavia, which means Nobel Prize season is here.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Video provides first clear views of WWII aircraft carriers lost in the pivotal Battle of Midway
description: Footage from deep in the Pacific Ocean has given the first detailed look at three World War II aircraft carriers that sank in the pivotal Battle of Midway and could help solve mysteries about the days-long barrage that marked a shift in control of the Pacific theater from Japanese to U.S. forces.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Japanese scientists find microplastics are present in clouds
description: Researchers in Japan have confirmed microplastics are present in clouds, where they are likely affecting the climate in ways that aren't yet fully understood.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Reducing fishing gear could save whales with low impacts to California's crab fishermen
description: Sometimes simple solutions are better. It all depends on the nature of the problem. For humpback whales, the problem is the rope connecting a crab trap on the seafloor to the buoy on the surface. And for fishermen, it's fishery closures caused by whale entanglements.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Scientists discover a durable but sensitive material for high energy X-ray detection
description: X-ray technology plays a vital role in medicine and scientific research, providing non-invasive medical imaging and insight into materials. Recent advancements in X-ray technology enable brighter, more intense beams and imaging of increasingly intricate systems in real-world conditions, like the insides of operating batteries.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Endangered red wolf can make it in the wild, but not without 'significant' help, study says
description: The endangered red wolf can survive in the wild, but only with "significant additional management intervention," according to a long-awaited population viability analysis released Friday.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Q&A: Seeing coastal storm impacts in advance can help communities prepare
description: Knowing the potential dangers posed by storm surge and high winds before a storm hits can help coastal communities and emergency responders prepare. Visualizations showing projected storm impacts can make the complex science behind the projections easy to understand and immediately available to individuals in the storm's path, according to Peter Stempel, associate professor of landscape architecture.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Striking rare gold: Researchers unveil new material infused with gold in an exotic chemical state
description: For the first time, Stanford researchers have found a way to create and stabilize an extremely rare form of gold that has lost two negatively charged electrons, denoted Au2+. The material stabilizing this elusive version of the valued element is a halide perovskite—a class of crystalline materials that holds great promise for various applications including more-efficient solar cells, light sources, and electronics components.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Timing plant evolution with a fast-ticking epigenetic clock
description: Recent discoveries in the field of epigenetics, the study of inheritance of traits that occur without changing the DNA sequence, have shown that chronological age in mammals correlates with epigenetic changes that accumulate during the lifetime of an individual.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
